doxygen.docBrief: Camera node used to set the projection matrix, viewport and scissor box
doxygen.doc: Sets up the projection with an user defined matrix for the viewing frustum(into the world coordinate system).
Note that some matrices (such as singular ones) may result in errors in bounding boxes, picking, and lighting.

of.name: scissor
of.doc: Determines the scissor box. It is automatically enabled if this field is defined, otherwise it is disabled. The default value is empty, i.e. scissor test is disabled.

doxygen.doc: All subsequent shapes in the scene graph will be clipped to the half-space defined by the \c plane field.
The half-space is the side of the plane in the direction of the plane normal.
Any number of clipping planes may be active simultaneously, although the graphics library may place a limit on this number during rendering (i.e. 6 for OpenGL).

of.name: on
of.doc: Specifies if the clipping plane is enabled or disabled.

doxygen.doc: The CullFace node specifies whether front-facing and/or back-facing facets can be culled.
Facets include triangles, quadrilaterals, polygons and rectangles.
FrontFace node specifies which of the clockwise and counterclockwise facets are front-facing and back-facing.

sf.name: mode
sf.doc: Specifies whether front-facing and/or back-facing facets can be culled.

value.name: FRONT_AND_BACK
value.doc: Front-facing and back-facing facets are culled

doxygen.doc: The FrontFace node specifies if polygons are in clockwise winding in window coordinates, or counterclockwise winding in window coordinates, are taken to be front-facing.

sf.name: orientation
sf.doc: Specifies if front facing polygons are clockwise (CW) or conterclockwise (CCW)

doxygen.doc: The Material node specifies current surface material properties for all subsequent shapes nodes
and is used by the lighting equations during rendering.
The field \c transparency is not optional because it is used by others fields (in OpenGL ambient and others use 4 floats).

sf.name: opacity
sf.doc: Sets opacity from 1.0 for being completely opaque until 0.0 for being completely transparent.

of.name: shininess
of.doc: Shininess coefficient of the surface. Values can range from 0.0 for no shininess (a diffuse surface) to 1.0 for maximum shininess (a highly polished surface).
